pullRequest.title: [VMware] vSphere advanced capabilities and Full OVF properties support
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
Combined PR of #4248 and #4250
Types of changes

 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 Enhancement (improves an existing feature and functionality)
 Cleanup (Code refactoring and cleanup, that may add test cases)

Screenshots (if appropriate):
How Has This Been Tested?

commit.message: Add new template and vm deploy as is details table and refactor
Refactor deploy as is constants
Fix daos issue
Fix typo

Dettached datadisk migration failed between NFS storages.
Fixed the issue of worker VM name being null

Fixed rat failure on new class DeployAsIsHelper.java
Also removed some unused imports during rebase
Removed few duplicate imports during rebase with master
Remove duplicate schema changes
Fix ISO upload on Deploy OVF task
Do not set user-configurable details for deploy-as-is VMs
Fix VM power sync NPE on system VMs
Use network adapter from OVF on deploy-as-is
Relocate deploy-as-is cloned VM if does not end on the host receiving the start command and restore deployment logs
Fix deploy as is with datadisks
VM deployment from ISO not working on VSAN65, fixed by adding a backup to create disk using old way
Handle guest OS read from deploy-as-is OVF descriptor
Fix deploy as-is disks cleanup
Fix for dettached disk migrations from vVols to other datastores
Added SesParse support which is an improved version of VMFSsparse virtual disk format
Display storage on logging when not deploy-as-is and guest OS small refactor
Fix mismatch from OVF nic adapter type and expected adapter type string
Fix reboot deploy-as-is VMs
Fail template registration when guest OS not found
Start addressing review comments

Fix startcommand on Datastore cluster when the volume datastore in CloudStack mismatches with vCenter datastore. Volume could have migrated with in datastore cluster which caused the mismatch

Fix dettach volume when volume is not on CloudStack intended datastore
Search in possible folders for volume while dettaching the volume
Set deploy-as-is to default on VMware
Fix for system VMs
Revert back deploy as is column on templates but keep it as default for new templates
Fix nested virt marvin test
Cleanup volume wrapper VM(ROOT-xxx) while deploying VM in case of any failure. since the same name will be used on retries and that will eventually fails saying volume wrapper VM already exists.
Handle detach volume of datastore cluster if the volume name has changed at vCenter level and reconsile the chaininfo
Reconcile chaininfo after attaching volume
Fix multidisk VM deployment on vVol datastore
Fix migrate root volume issue caused by regression from one of the commits
Fix reset/restore VM

Fixed import VM for NFS storage which added as presetup.
Previous code assumes the NFS storage is always added by CloudStack, but NFS can also be added as presetup storagepool.
Fix restrictions on attach and restore VMs
Remove deploy as is option from the old UI
service offering response: added vsphere storage policy to response if exists
Disk offering response: added vsphere storage policy to response if exists
Adding vSphere storage policy to disk on start command and attach volume command
Added storage policy details to disk while creating disk and restricted migration of volumes to storage pools which are not storage policy compliance
Fixed the issue of VM deletion not cleaning the VM folder on vVols datastore. Fixed it by deleting the VM as complete entity including the extra root disks.
Fix deploy-as-is templates GC
Reconcile root disk controller fix
Check storage policy of disk offering if it suitable for storage pool while using migratevirtualmachinewithvolume API
Ensure deploy as is disks get allocated to the same storage pool
Fix remove VM and its volumes for deploy-as-is if have previously failed - restore cpu flags in nested virtualization test
Throwing error if ostypeid, nicAdapter, rootDiskController is passed for VMWare templates
Throwing error if boot type or boot mode specified while deploying VMs on VMware
Elaborating error
Fix template registration
Add missing guest OS entries for VMware

beforeCommit.message: Add missing guest OS entries for VMware

afterCommit.message: Add missing guest OS entries for VMware

commit.message: Fix reinstall VM bug
guest-os-GC (#67)
Smoke test for VMWare storage policies.
Fix restore VM workflow - clone and replace existing VM instead of cloning and moving disks
Merge branch 'ovfprops-and-vsphere-adv-together' of github.com:shapeblue/cloudstack into ovfprops-and-vsphere-adv-together
Remove unused code

nodes.bodyText: sensible comments, but I would like to see this be partitioned into methods of which the names reflect these comments. this method is long and thus rather hard to understand. also it is hard to check if it does what it says on the tin, certainly after a few rounds of maintenance.

+
+
+class TestVMWareStoragePolicies(cloudstackTestCase):
+
+    @classmethod

+
+        cls.testClient = super(TestVMWareStoragePolicies, cls).getClsTestClient()
+        cls.apiclient = cls.testClient.getApiClient()
+
+        cls.testdata = cls.testClient.getParsedTestDataConfig()
+        # Get Zone, Domain and templates
+        cls.domain = get_domain(cls.apiclient)
+        cls.zone = get_zone(cls.apiclient, cls.testClient.getZoneForTests())
+        cls._cleanup = []
+        cls.hypervisor = cls.testClient.getHypervisorInfo()
+        cls.network_offering = NetworkOffering.create(
+            cls.apiclient,
+            cls.testdata["l2-network_offering"],
+        )
+        cls.network_offering.update(cls.apiclient, state='Enabled')
+        cls.template = get_test_template(
+            cls.apiclient,
+            cls.zone.id,
+            cls.hypervisor,
+        )
+        cls.cleanup = [cls.network_offering]
+        return
+
+    @classmethod
+    def tearDownClass(cls):
+        try:
+            cleanup_resources(cls.apiclient, cls.cleanup)
+        except Exception as e:
+            raise Exception("Warning: Exception during cleanup : %s" % e)
+
+    def setUp(self):
+
+        self.dbclient = self.testClient.getDbConnection()
+        self.hypervisor = self.testClient.getHypervisorInfo()
+        self.testdata["virtual_machine"]["zoneid"] = self.zone.id
+        self.testdata["virtual_machine"]["template"] = self.template.id
+        self.account = Account.create(
+            self.apiclient,
+            self.testdata["account"],
+            domainid=self.domain.id
+        )
+        self.cleanup = [self.account]
+        return
+
+    def tearDown(self):
+        try:
+            self.debug("Cleaning up the resources")
+            cleanup_resources(self.apiclient, self.cleanup)
+            self.debug("Cleanup complete!")
+        except Exception as e:
+            self.debug("Warning! Exception in tearDown: %s" % e)
+
+    def import_vmware_storage_policies(self, apiclient):
+        cmd = importVsphereStoragePolicies.importVsphereStoragePoliciesCmd()
+        cmd.zoneid = self.zone.id
+        return apiclient.importVsphereStoragePolicies(cmd)
+
+    def list_storage_policies(self, apiclient):
+        cmd = listVsphereStoragePolicies.listVsphereStoragePoliciesCmd()
+        cmd.zoneid = self.zone.id
+        return apiclient.listVsphereStoragePolicies(cmd)

+            "eip",
+            "advancedns",
+            "basic",
+            "sg"],
+        required_hardware="true")
+    def test_01_import_storage_policies(self):
+        """Test VMWare storage policies
+        """
+
+        # Validate the following:
+        # 1. Import VMWare storage policies - the command should return non-zero result
+        # 2. List current VMWare storage policies - the command should return non-zero result
+        # 3. Create service offering with first of the imported policies
+        # 4. Create disk offering with first of the imported policies
+        # 5. Create VM using the already created service offering
+        # 6. Create volume using the already created disk offering
+        # 7. Attach this volume to our VM
+        # 8. Detach the volume from our VM

commit.message: class object cleanup and append
cleanup the right object list in the right order
object creation seperated from filling it
make sure dependencies get cleaned up after their depenedants
readability/formatting
Fix boot into hardware
Fix smoke tests passing osTypeId parameter on VMware templates registration
Fixes after smoke tests results on VMware
Do not fail if osTypeId parameter or rootdiskcontroller/nicadapter details are set on template registration
Fix macchinina checksums for VMware
Merge branch 'master' into ovfprops-and-vsphere-adv-together
Fix detach volume on stopped Vms
Add new API to check storage policy compatible pools and fix marvin test for storage policies
Fix unit test failure
Fix for none type response error handling
Check there is at least a host to verify pool compatibility for a storage policy
Fix storage policy smoke test

beforeCommit.message: Added storage policy details to disk while creating disk and restricted migration of volumes to storage pools which are not storage policy compliance

afterCommit.message: Added storage policy details to disk while creating disk and restricted migration of volumes to storage pools which are not storage policy compliance

beforeCommit.message: Fix remove VM and its volumes for deploy-as-is if have previously failed - restore cpu flags in nested virtualization test

afterCommit.message: Fix remove VM and its volumes for deploy-as-is if have previously failed - restore cpu flags in nested virtualization test

commit.message: Initial commit adding few required managed object classes and added pbm sdk
Added PBM service connect
Fix root folder issue on datastore
Added importVsphereStoragePolicies API and scheme changes
Fixed bean creation errors on VsphereStoragePolicyDaoImpl
Added Storage policy id to VO
Moved Dao and VO files to different packages
Added gen_toc.py changes for API importvpsherestoragepolicies
Fixed unit test failure
Updated code to handle sync of storage policies when importVsphereStoragePolicies API is called multiple times

Check if datastore is complaince with the storagepolicy provided in the disk offering.
Added corresponding manager objects from PBM sdk to do the job.
Made dao layer changes to read the storage policy in diskoffering
Added Storagepolicy while creating diskoffering. CreateDiskOffering API now takes storagepolicy as a parameter with UUID value
Unit test fix
Fix NPE in case of preparing secondarystorage on Host

Use VStorageObjectManager for disk operations.

Created disks using VStorageObjectManager
Removed redundant code around attach volume and create volumes
Added PBM jar dependency for vsphere 6.7 version
Bug fixing on default base folder
VMFS to presetup change
UI changes and accept any type of datastore as presetup in vmware
importVsphereStoragePolices improvements
Fix importstorage policies to update deleted policies on vcenter
Fix response list on importVsphereStoragePoliciescmd
Added listVsphereStoragePoliciesCmd
Logging variable name change
DataStore Clusters addition as a storage pool
Assetion fix in StorageTest.java
Import storagepolicies when vmware datacenter is added or updated

Add Datastore cluster and the child entities which are datastores in the cluster into CloudStack

Setting scope is still pending.
Register Disk to first class disk whereever possible
Allocation logic to skip datastore cluster and consider only storagepools inside the datastore cluster
Handle datastore clusters in list storage pools to list only parent not the children in the Datastore cluster
Fix adding Datastore clusters and listing
Datastore Clusters operations on putting into maintenance mode, update storage pool with tags, cancelling mantenance mode and deleting storage pool
Fix NPE on one of the register disk usecases
Datastore cluster: update tag to the child storagepools also
Generalise linked clone formats which are different for each datastore type
Fix immutable list to add another entry to list
inter-cluster migration support

Use clonevm task while creating template from volume

Old way is by taking snapshot of entire VM and then clone from that snapshot with the required disk
Datastore cluster maintenance failure case handling.
Add checks before actual deletion of datastore cluster
Fix updateconfiguration API to add settings to child datastores in case of datastore clusters
Fix prepare template API incase of Datastore cluster
Fix ListVMsCmd with storageid as datastore cluster
Fix migrate vm and volume APIs in case if datastore cluster
Handle listsystemvms cmd in case of datastore clusters
Adding Storagepolicies to the service offering for root disks
Base folder creation on datstores restrict only to primary storages, for secondary storage datastore it is not required
Fix test cases
Changed workflow for storing volumes in sec storage
fix some more test cases
Changed artifact id from pbm for vmware-pbm for policy based management
Deleted temporary files
Fixed unexpected token Exception
Fix simulator code for SimulatorStorageProcessor.java
Handle failure case of putting datastore cluster on maintenance mode
Simulator failures fixing
Fixed a smoke test while taking snapshot
Remove registering virtual disk code
Fix addition of datastore clusters not to configure it as non NFS storage
Fix addition of datastores with invalid vCenter server details
Fix findstoragepoolsformigration cmd not to list the parent datastore cluster as suitable storagepool
Handle volume copy from secondary to primary in case of vSAN
Fix list volume response to list datastore cluster name and id instead of child datastore
Removed unused imports caused due to some merge conflicts
Handle VMFS6 sesparse format disk files
Keep retry logic for make directory method which is returning false positive yet times
Fix proper error message on revert volume snapshot operation in case of any hypervisor other than KVM
Fix list volumes cmd and update volume cmd to accept datastore cluster as storgeid
Fix destination hostname for stopped VMs in case of reset ssh keys
Fix enable primary datastore maintenance command seriliaztion on it

Fix travis failures by removing dependency of vmware from storage.
Added a new command class to verify the vCenter details provided while adding primary storage
Set back the datastore cluster state to UP upon on failure in prepare maintenance
Handle import unmanaged VM into CloudStack to support any type of datastore
Fix fcd from being deleted when empty
[VMware] Full OVF properties support
Remove extra line after merging
Added backup on fail over scenrio in case of new create disk method
vVols datastore support added
Fixed volume migrations to and fro vVols datastorewq
Fix seeding template issue after PR merging
prepare for maintenance of storage pool of type datastore cluster should not try to cancel the maintenance upon failure, rather keep it in error in maintenance state
Snapshot on dettached volume considering wrong path, corrected it

Delete VM fix which does not move detached disks to fcd folder
vVols attach disk fix
Add new template and vm deploy as is details table and refactor
Refactor deploy as is constants
Fix daos issue
Fix typo

Dettached datadisk migration failed between NFS storages.
Fixed the issue of worker VM name being null
Fix zone to zone scope volume migrations NPE
